p: The northern expansion of vectors like ticks and mosquitoes lead to the emergence of VBDs in North America and Scandinavian. The tick-borne diseases include diseases like babesiosis, anaplasmoses, and Powassan encephalitis, while the mosquito-borne diseases involve diseases like dengue fever and malaria. Other victors like sandflies introduced diseases like Lyme disease, Boutonneuse fever and leishmaniasis. Similarly, the southern expansion of victors in Australia increased the prevalence of insect-borne diseases according to health records such as Ross River virus, Murray Valley encephalitis and Barmah Forest virus (Greer et al. 2008).
